body:
@xiao1228 In the previous version of the code, learning rate is divided by 10 after 50. epoch. In the current version, learning rate is divided by 10 after 250. epoch. I think it is the problem.

https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/49ae0a55b16b97fc6f46eeb736a87b99337256ca/train.py#L98
hi @fatihbaltaci , yes, I am wondering did @glenn-jocher obtained the 54.9mAP with the current set up or not?
@xiao1228 54.9 mAP is obtained with the official `yolov3.weights` by following exactly the code shown in the README: https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3#map.
@glenn-jocher I see. I thought it was from the latest.pt. Thank you very much for the answer!
@xiao1228 no, this is from the official weights. Unfortunately it takes so long to fully train (270 epochs) that we haven't been able to properly test out that far.
@glenn-jocher ,how about the best result with latest.pt?about MAP=52.2?

repository.name: yolov3
repository.description: YOLOv3 in PyTorch > ONNX > CoreML > TFLite

body: @gittigxuy we haven't trained out to a full 270 epochs, so we don't have a proper self-trained mAP. If you have GPU time available we'd be more than happy to hear your results though!

Final results are in, and PR https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/pull/176 complete. Repo mAP now aligns with COCO mAP under most circumstances to within 1%. Also mAP output now exceeds yolov3 darknet published results. | [ultralytics/yolov3](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3) with `pycocotools` | [darknet/yolov3](https://arxiv.org/abs/1804.02767) --- | --- | --- YOLOv3-320 | 51.8 | 51.5 YOLOv3-416 | 55.4 | 55.3 YOLOv3-608 | 58.2 | 57.9 ``` bash sudo rm -rf yolov3 && git clone https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3 # bash yolov3/data/get_coco_dataset.sh sudo rm -rf cocoapi && git clone https://github.com/cocodataset/cocoapi && cd cocoapi/PythonAPI && make && cd ../.. && cp -r cocoapi/PythonAPI/pycocotools yolov3 cd yolov3 python3 test.py --save-json --conf-thres 0.001 --img-size 416 Namespace(batch_size=32, cfg='cfg/yolov3.cfg', conf_thres=0.001, data_cfg='cfg/coco.data', img_size=416, iou_thres=0.5, nms_thres=0.5, save_json=True, weights='weights/yolov3.weights') Using cuda _CudaDeviceProperties(name='Tesla V100-SXM2-16GB', major=7, minor=0, total_memory=16130MB, multi_processor_count=80) Image @glenn-jocher ,could you share the model?I have trained about 50 epoch,but mAP is about 0.45,I change the optimizer to adabound which is a new optimizer.how to train the result as good as your result?
